pullRequest.body:
The construction of the isomorphism of `Aut F` with the inverse limit of the automorphism groups of the Galois objects restricts the target category of `F` to be `FintypeCat.{v}` where `v` is the `Hom`-universe of `C`. Still, the transitivity of the action of `Aut F` on the fibers of connected objects can be generalized to arbitrary `F : C â¥¤ FintypeCat.{w}` by post-composing with an equivalence `FintypeCat.{v} â‰Œ FintypeCat.{w}`.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->
- [x] depends on: #16661

This generalization is necessary to obtain the result that a fiber functor `F` induces an equivalence with the category of finite discrete `Aut F`-sets for not-necessarily (essentially) small categories.

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->
This looks very nice!

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10835920941/job/30068487179)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10835920941/job/30068487644)
Thanks for the reviews!

Thanks :tada:

bors merge

Thanks :tada:

bors merge
Can you factor out this repeated term to its own lemma?
I don't think there really is a duplicated term, but I rearranged things so that one auxiliary lemma and `simp` can prove it.

```suggestion
lemma switchUniverseEquiv_symm_naturality {X Y : FintypeCat.{u}} (f : X âŸ¶ Y) (x : X) :
```
Could you try to avoid the use of `Equivalence.mk`?
Changed. What is the reason for preferring the direct constructor over `Equivalence.mk`?
See the description of #15919.
Could you insert a comment (here or in the docstring of the file) about the strategy regarding the universes and the splitting into two sectons `General/Specialized`?
I added some explanation.

```suggestion
noncomputable def uLift : FintypeCat.{u} â¥¤ FintypeCat.{v} where
```
is a bit shorter? Or is there a reason to avoid this name?

Aaah, silly me... the universe doesn't have to increase...
So what about
```suggestion
noncomputable def uSwitch : FintypeCat.{u} â¥¤ FintypeCat.{v} where
```
Or is that too obscure?

I am fine with `uSwitch`, although there is [CategoryTheory.uliftFunctor](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/CategoryTheory/Types.html#CategoryTheory.uliftFunctor) so maybe analogous to that it could be called `uswitchFunctor` but that is long again. What do you say? `uSwitch` or `uswitchFunctor`?
Hmm, let's just go with the short name. Because we don't need to disambiguate in this case.
Done

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(CategoryTheory/Galois): generalize transitivity to arbitrary universes
